description:
It was inaccurate to have Density Projections labeled as "Density g/cm^2", when it's really "Projected Density g/cm^2".  This corrects that issue for any projected field.

Before:
http://i.imgur.com/vBSRRLq.png

After:
http://i.imgur.com/UP6f5Nh.png
title: ProjectionPlots now include prepended "Projected" on color bar for whatever field is projected

pullrequest.title: ProjectionPlots now include prepended "Projected" on color bar for whatever field is projected

content.raw: I'd prefer if this weren't controlled via a keyword argument. We should have a default choice and stick to it while still allowing customization after the plot is created. In this case, that would be via a `set_colorbar_label` function, which John Regan has already implemented in a pending PR.  `projected` should be `True` for all unweighted projections.
content.html: I'd prefer if this weren't controlled via a keyword argument. We should have a default choice and stick to it while still allowing customization after the plot is created. In this case, that would be via a set_colorbar_label function, which John Regan has already implemented in a pending PR. projected should be True for all unweighted projections.

pullrequest.title: ProjectionPlots now include prepended "Projected" on color bar for whatever field is projected

content.raw:
I wasn't sure how to do this without setting a keyword argument, since the `PlotWindow` class is the supersuperclass to the projection classes, and I didn't see any other way of passing that information back up the chain of command when generating the actual plot.  Do you have any other suggestions as to how to do this without a keyword set?

It seems like this is still consistent with @johnregan 's pull request #980, isn't it?  One can still modify the colorbar label to whatever value they want.  My PR just sets the default when you're dealing with a projected quantity.
content.html:
I wasn't sure how to do this without setting a keyword argument, since the PlotWindow class is the supersuperclass to the projection classes, and I didn't see any other way of passing that information back up the chain of command when generating the actual plot. Do you have any other suggestions as to how to do this without a keyword set?

It seems like this is still consistent with johnregan 's pull request #980, isn't it? One can still modify the colorbar label to whatever value they want. My PR just sets the default when you're dealing with a projected quantity.

pullrequest.title: ProjectionPlots now include prepended "Projected" on color bar for whatever field is projected

content.raw: On line 917 below you could replace `if self.projected` with `if hasattr(self, 'projected)`, and only set `projected = True` in the `ProjectionPlot` and `OffAxisProjectionPlot` constructor.  Alternatively, you could make `projected` an attribute of all `PlotWindow` instances that defaults to `False` and is overrided in the `ProjectionPlot` and `OffAxisProjectionPlot` initializers if `weight_field` is `None`.
content.html: On line 917 below you could replace if self.projected with if hasattr(self, 'projected), and only set projected = True in the ProjectionPlot and OffAxisProjectionPlot constructor. Alternatively, you could make projected an attribute of all PlotWindow instances that defaults to False and is overrided in the ProjectionPlot and OffAxisProjectionPlot initializers if weight_field is None.

pullrequest.title: ProjectionPlots now include prepended "Projected" on color bar for whatever field is projected

content.raw:
It changes a large amount of user facing stuff - even if it is not brought
up for discussion, at least notification would be nice. At the risk of
bikeshedding, my reading of the commit is that this always prepends, rather
than just for integration style projections, which would give the wrong
impression for MIP and weighted projections.
content.html: It changes a large amount of user facing stuff - even if it is not brought up for discussion, at least notification would be nice. At the risk of bikeshedding, my reading of the commit is that this always prepends, rather than just for integration style projections, which would give the wrong impression for MIP and weighted projections.

pullrequest.title: ProjectionPlots now include prepended "Projected" on color bar for whatever field is projected

content.raw: Yeah, I realized after @ngoldbaum 's comments that I should only include the prepend for non-weighted Projections.  I'm modifying this now.  I'll send an email to the list letting people know about this change, but I honestly thought that this was just a bugfix to provide a more accurate result since currently showing people a density projection with the colorbar labeled density seems inaccurate.
content.html: Yeah, I realized after Nathan Goldbaum 's comments that I should only include the prepend for non-weighted Projections. I'm modifying this now. I'll send an email to the list letting people know about this change, but I honestly thought that this was just a bugfix to provide a more accurate result since currently showing people a density projection with the colorbar labeled density seems inaccurate.

pullrequest.title: ProjectionPlots now include prepended "Projected" on color bar for whatever field is projected

content.raw: Yeah, I think it warrants an email to the list. I'm trying to think if it will make emissivity or SZ fields more or less confusing, and I'm not sure.
content.html: Yeah, I think it warrants an email to the list. I'm trying to think if it will make emissivity or SZ fields more or less confusing, and I'm not sure.

pullrequest.title: ProjectionPlots now include prepended "Projected" on color bar for whatever field is projected

content.raw:
Do you think we should also modify weighted projections to indicate this in the field label?

e.g.

Density-Weighted Temperature?

or 

Temperature weighted by Density?

or

Temperature_{Density}?

Or something like that?
content.html:
Do you think we should also modify weighted projections to indicate this in the field label?

e.g.

Density-Weighted Temperature?

or

Temperature weighted by Density?

or

Temperature_{Density}?

Or something like that?

pullrequest.title: ProjectionPlots now include prepended "Projected" on color bar for whatever field is projected

content.raw: Seems easier to me to just use a set_colorbar_label function like what pull request #980 is doing, but I think this will be an opinion that a lot of people might vary on. If you want to change the very user-facing default, which this does, I think it should go through a YTEP or mailing list.
content.html: Seems easier to me to just use a set_colorbar_label function like what pull request #980 is doing, but I think this will be an opinion that a lot of people might vary on. If you want to change the very user-facing default, which this does, I think it should go through a YTEP or mailing list.

content.raw: `proj_style='sum'` or `proj_style='mip'`.  In principle we could define more in the future.
content.html: proj_style='sum' or proj_style='mip'. In principle we could define more in the future.

pullrequest.title: ProjectionPlots now include prepended "Projected" on color bar for whatever field is projected

content.raw: Wouldn't `proj_style='sum'` also require a "Projected" prepended to those fields?  Isn't summing the same as integrating in this context?  I'm afraid I don't know what `mip` is in this case.
content.html: Wouldn't proj_style='sum' also require a "Projected" prepended to those fields? Isn't summing the same as integrating in this context? I'm afraid I don't know what mip is in this case.

pullrequest.title: ProjectionPlots now include prepended "Projected" on color bar for whatever field is projected

content.raw: Maximum intensity projection.
content.html: Maximum intensity projection.

pullrequest.title: ProjectionPlots now include prepended "Projected" on color bar for whatever field is projected

content.raw:
`'mip'` is maximum intensity projection - instead of summing or integrating it just picks out the maximum value along a line of sight.

`'sum'` shouldn't be labeled as projected because the units don't change.  Maybe you could say 'summed' although I'm not sure that's less confusing.
content.html:
'mip' is maximum intensity projection - instead of summing or integrating it just picks out the maximum value along a line of sight.

'sum' shouldn't be labeled as projected because the units don't change. Maybe you could say 'summed' although I'm not sure that's less confusing.

content.raw: I need to test this one more time to make sure it works as stated.  I've set "Projected" as the prepend for now.  If anyone would prefer "Integrated" to "Projected", now is the time to raise your voice.  I'll report back here when this is tested.

pullrequest.title: ProjectionPlots now include prepended "Projected" on color bar for whatever field is projected

content.raw:
I'm hitting merge once the tests are reported back, but one thing I might like to see if we do further refinement is to switch away from a `projected` attribute on the object, and toward a `prepend_title` or something instead.  Since right now there's only one type, this is good to go, but maybe in the future that'd be a possible refactoring.

Thanks, Cameron.  This will be an improvement for the UX.
content.html:
I'm hitting merge once the tests are reported back, but one thing I might like to see if we do further refinement is to switch away from a projected attribute on the object, and toward a prepend_title or something instead. Since right now there's only one type, this is good to go, but maybe in the future that'd be a possible refactoring.

Thanks, Cameron. This will be an improvement for the UX.
